result.execSummary:
The defendant Pedro Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken

Defendant Pedro Lopez in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 20 days in jail, consecutive to any other previously imposed sentence, with Huber.  Submit DNA sample.  $543.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  4 days jail credit.  Jail start 6/5/16 7:00 pm
Authorization to Appear and Act filed.

Defendant, Pedro Lopez, appeared by video with Atty. Benavides, special for public defender office. Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $1,000 recog. bond with no contact K.P., juvenile M.J.P., her other children, her residence, may return one time with officer to get belongings. Maintain absolute sobriety; not go upon premises that serve alcohol for on-site consumption. Not possess alcohol. Child they have in common visitation must be made through 3rd party contact with mother.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 10:40 am.  Return date scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
